chart_of_accounts.title: Chart of Accounts — Tips
chart_of_accounts.description: Use the chart of accounts to define your GL structure and (only when eligible) opening balances.
items: Choose the correct Account Type first. In this system, only Cash/Bank type accounts show the Opening section.
Opening is intended for initial setup (migration). After you go live, use Journal Entries instead of changing openings.
If you use multi-currency, confirm Currency + Rate before saving; base currency accounts should keep rate locked.
Use a clear numbering structure (e.g. 1xxx Assets, 2xxx Liabilities, 3xxx Equity, 4xxx Income, 5xxx Expenses) so reports stay readable.

account_transfer.title: Account Transfer — Tips
account_transfer.description: Move money between two accounts without affecting income/expense.
items: From Account and To Account cannot be the same.
Use the correct currency and exchange rate for the transfer date (base currency rate is fixed).
Add a clear remark (reason/reference) so bank/cash reconciliation is easy later.

journal_entry.title: Journal Entry — Tips
journal_entry.description: Use journal entries for adjustments, openings (when needed), and corrections.
items: Total Debit must equal Total Credit before you can save.
Avoid posting directly to Cash/Bank for sales/purchases if you already use Sales/Purchase modules—keep entries consistent.
Use Ledger and Bill Number fields when you want the entry linked to a customer/supplier and document reference.
If you attach a document, keep it to one clear file (invoice/receipt) for audit trail.

inventory_item.title: Inventory Item — Tips
inventory_item.description: Define items with the right type, codes, accounts, and opening stock.
items: Item Type controls behavior: inventory/stock items affect on-hand quantity; non-inventory items are used for services/charges.
SKU: use a unique Stock Keeping Unit for fast search, barcode integration, and avoiding duplicates.
Account assignments matter: Asset account is used for stock value, Income account for sales, Cost account for cost of goods sold.
Min/Max stock levels help you detect under-stock and over-stock; set them for reorder alerts and planning.
Opening stock: use it only for your starting balance. Prefer entering it per store with correct batch/expiry when applicable.

fast_entry.title: Fast Entry (Items) — Tips
fast_entry.description: Quickly create many items in one screen.
items: Codes are auto-generated; fill the Name and Measure first for fastest workflow.
Leave completely empty rows blank—only filled rows are saved.
Use Store + Quantity + Batch/Expiry when you want to create items and set initial stock in one go.

fast_opening.title: Fast Opening (Items) — Tips
fast_opening.description: Enter opening quantities for many items quickly.
items: Use Fast Opening only for the first-time opening/migration; after go-live, use purchases, transfers, and adjustments.
Always select the correct Store; openings are store-specific.
For batch/expiry managed items, fill Batch + Expiry consistently to avoid duplicate/merged stock lines.

transfer.title: Transfer (Inventory) — Tips
items: Pick the correct From Store and To Store; transfers change on-hand quantity in both.
Use the same batch/expiry details when transferring batch-controlled items so reports remain consistent.
Add remarks for internal traceability (who requested, why, and reference).

ledgers.title: Ledgers (Customers/Suppliers) — Tips
ledgers.description: Ledgers represent parties you buy from or sell to.
items: Keep names consistent and unique to avoid duplicate parties.
If you are migrating, set Opening/Old Balance carefully (debit vs credit) so statements match.
Use phone/address details to improve invoice printing and follow-ups.

owner.title: Owner — Tips
owner.description: Owners represent partners/shareholders used for equity tracking.
items: Create one owner record per partner so drawings and capital movements can be tracked separately.
Use clear remarks for initial capital, additional capital, or drawings references.

expense.title: Expense — Tips
expense.description: Record expense transactions with proper accounts and (optional) ledgers.
items: If you use multiple lines, ensure totals balance as expected (debit/credit rules).
Use Ledger when the expense is payable/receivable to a party (supplier/employee).
Attach the supporting document (bill/receipt) to simplify audits.

purchase.title: Purchase — Tips
purchase.description: Record purchases that affect inventory and supplier balance.
items: Select the correct Supplier ledger so payables and statements are accurate.
Use the correct Store; it controls where stock increases.
Check item Measure and prices; incorrect units can distort stock valuation and reports.

sales.title: Sales — Tips
sales.description: Record sales that affect inventory and customer balance.
items: Select the correct Customer ledger so receivables and statements are accurate.
Confirm item quantity and price; stock will reduce for inventory items.
Use discounts/taxes consistently to keep profit reports correct.

receipt.title: Receipt — Tips
receipt.description: Record money received from customers or other sources.
items: Choose the correct Cash/Bank account as the receiving account.
Use Cheque Number / reference fields for non-cash receipts.
If you see Old Balance, it helps you confirm how this receipt impacts the ledger balance.

payments.title: Payments — Tips
payments.description: Record money paid to suppliers or other parties.
items: Choose the correct Cash/Bank account as the paying account.
Use cheque/reference details for bank payments.
Double-check currency and rate to avoid balance differences.

user_management.title: User Management — Tips
user_management.description: Manage users, roles, and permissions safely.
items: Use Roles to group permissions—avoid assigning many permissions directly to each user.
Give the minimum permissions required (least privilege) to reduce mistakes and risk.
If a user can edit financial transactions, consider enabling approval/locking rules in Preferences.

preferences.title: Preferences — Tips
preferences.description: Preferences control how forms and transactions behave across the system.
items: Item Management controls which fields appear on the Item screens; hide unused fields for faster data entry.
Sale/Purchase tabs let you choose visible columns and numbering; set them before daily usage starts.
Backup/Export preferences should be configured early so data recovery is always possible.
